paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 gene variant c.361del associated with Long QT Syndrome type 2.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Despite the low occurrence of sex-related arrhythmias or sudden cardiac death in patients with LQTS, orgasm induced torsades de pointes has been reported in a Long QT Syndrome type 2 (LQT2) patient with a mutation (c.361del) in the KCNH2 gene (chromosome 7q36).

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with increased risk of torsades de pointes during sexual activity.

variants.additional_notes: The variant is linked to a specific clinical presentation of LQT2.
key_quotes: Despite the low occurrence of sex-related arrhythmias or sudden cardiac death in patients with LQTS, orgasm induced torsades de pointes has been reported in a Long QT Syndrome type 2 (LQT2) patient with a mutation (c.361del) in the KCNH2 gene (chromosome 7q36).

extraction_metadata.notes: Only one variant in KCNH2 was reported in the paper.
